page.title: 01RHAYADER and DISTRICT
page.content: The area consists of the parishes of Rhayader, Cwmdeuddwr, St.Harmon, and Nantmel, and is in the county of Powys. The market town of Rhayader is at a height of 700ft with surrounding hills reaching a maximum of 1400ft on Gwastedyn Hill. It is situated on the junction of A44 and A470 trunk roads, and is visited by traffic passing through to the Welsh coast and the nearby Elan Valley resevoirs. The river Wye and the Ryd-hir Brook flow through the town. The area has small deciduous woods, fields surrounded by deciduous hedges and hills covered with Gorse and Heather. The town has a population of 1500 with Tourism, Farming and some Industry as the main sources of employment.
